Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Companionship \Com*pan"ion*ship\, n. Fellowship; association; the act or fact of keeping company with any one. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
He never seemed to avail himself of my sympathy other than by mere companionship. --W. Irving [1913 Webster]
companionship n : the state of being with someone; "he missed their company"; "he enjoyed the society of his friends" [syn: {company}, {fellowship}, {society}]
